title: What is the most strategic battle in WWII? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the Pacific, the battle of Midway was one of the most strategic, as well as the Battle of the Philippines Sea (Leyte Gulf). Guadalcanal was a turning point In Europe, Stalingrad was the turning point and the Battle of Kursk was one of the most strategic, it was the last time the Germans were on the offensive in the east. The Battle of Normandy was a strategic victory for the Allies as well.
Battles are events and strategies are plans, basically two different things, so the question you are asking doesn’t really make sense.
